project.teaser: The GENDEX mission consists of the development of the Pilot Innovation Gender and Diversity Index, providing consistent information (currently missing or fragmented) to startups, scaleups, corporates, the EIC, other investors and funding bodies, market actors and policy makers...
project.objective:
The GENDEX mission consists of the development of the Pilot Innovation Gender and Diversity Index, providing consistent information (currently missing or fragmented) to startups, scaleups, corporates, the EIC, other investors and funding bodies, market actors and policy makers across Europe. The overall aim is to improve the availability of all talent, particularly female talent, to the EIC portfolio of projects and companies and the EU innovation ecosystem. For the first time ever, a G&D Index will be elaborated including a wide range of indicators related to gender but also to diversity factors covering all European Member States plus the U.K. GENDEX will review the existing baseline and access a high number of data sources, but it will bring a unique value by carrying out additional primary research both at quantitative and qualitative levels. Data sets will be assessed, gaps will be identified, a more standard-based approach to data will be suggested, all resulting in a richer definition of indicators and hence a G&D Index that will become a reference in Europe supporting evidence-based decision-making. A full report on the Index will be released with complementary material, including a web-based interactive dashboard that will enable smart data visualizations and a widget that will be used for company self-assessment and as a potential data collection tool. A wide dissemination, communication and awareness campaign will be implemented to ensure engagement and maximize the adoption of the G&D Index.
The GENDEX consortium comprises a complementary set of recognized partners that includes IDC, European Women in VC and BluSpecs, authors of some of the key works in the field and also a guarantee of the best possible networks for stakeholder engagement. Such engagement will ultimately lead to maximization of the use of the G&D Index and hence, of its impact. GENDEX will also run a 2-phase validation with an experts’ group composed of at least 18 senior leaders.
project.title: Gender and Diversity Index for a fair, competitive, resilient and sustainable Europe
project.keywords: Gender, Diversity, Index, performance, decision-making, data visualization, dashboard, recommendations, evidence-based policy making, innovation landscape, start-ups, scale-ups, VCs, EIC

article.title: Closing the innovation gap by addressing gender and diversity disparities

result.title: GENDEX data management plan
result.description: This deliverable describes the FAIR data and research output management, comprising types, findability, accessibility, interoperability, and curation

result.title: Interactive Dashboard and Widget
result.description: The interactive dashboard will be accessible from the website and will allow users to visualize the data in smart ways, it will allow for comparisons contributing to better understanding. The widget has been thought as a tool for companies to do a self-assessment from the gender and diversity points of view and as a tool to capture data

result.title: Exploitation, Sustainability and Recommendations
result.description: In order to maximize the potential impact of the Index, GENDEX will develop pathways for different stakeholders, looking at the credibility, acceptance, usage and future developments upon the first Pilot.

result.title: Analysis of data of the G&D Scorecard
result.description: Final report in PDF approved by stakeholders, with a Power Point presentation highlighting the main results of the project

result.title: Communication & Dissemination Activity Report & Impact Assessment
result.description: This document will report all the activities developed by the project as part of the Communication, dissemination and marketing plan and will assess performance and impact.

result.title: Report on the state of the art
result.description: A review of the tools, sources of data and reports most commonly used by investors and funding bodies, market actors and policy makers across Europe to track diversity

result.title: Qualitative Interviews Results
result.description: Summary of qualitative interviews (Word file highlighting the outcomes of interviews and picking up quotes that may be included in the report of the Index)

result.title: Validated Index Scorecard
result.description: Final version of Index validated by and agreed upon with the EIC and expert community, in Excel

result.title: GENDEX Website
result.description: Comprehensive, visually attractive and usability compliant website providing complete information about the G&D Index development

result.title: GENDEX Communication and Dissemination Strategy
result.description: Report highlighting the main activity pillars, proposed actions for each of them and relationship between the activities and their expected impact, including KPI framework. Deep segmentation of stakeholders and associated actions will be a key aspect.

result.title: G&D Scorecard v2.0
result.description: Scorecard v2.0 (in comparison to G&D Scorecard v1.0) consists of a draft version of the European innovation gender & diversity index populated with the data for the European countries, in Excel

result.title: Quantitative Survey Results
result.description: Tables with results of the quantitative survey (Excel file with structured results of the survey broken down according to countries and other criteria)

result.title: Data collection tools
result.description: Excel file and Web tool for structured collection of data, draft report structure (Word document with a proposed table of contents), questionnaire (structured Word document for a quantitative survey) and discussion guide (Word document with instructions for conducting the qualitative interviews)

result.title: G&D Scorecard v1.0
result.description: G&D Scorecard v1.0 including the validated set of indicators to measure diversity, identify gaps and enable action to be taken by actors across the European innovation and entrepreneurship landscape

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - GENDEX (Gender and Diversity Index for a fair, competitive, resilient and sustainable Europe)
result.teaser: GENDEX aims to create a comprehensive and actionable index for the European innovation landscape, addressing significant gender disparities in leadership positions and investment sectors across the Deep Tech ecosystem. By providing detailed data on gender diversity and its...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
